Slope

namespace slope

Functions

template<typename T>
double computeMaxDelta(const T &x, const Eigen::VectorXd &x_centers, const Eigen::VectorXd &x_scales, const Eigen::VectorXd &w, const Eigen::VectorXd &beta_old, const Eigen::VectorXd &beta, bool standardize)

Computes the maximum delta value for the given inputs.

Template Parameters:

T – The type of the input data.

Parameters:

  • x – The input data.

  • x_centers – The centers of the input data.

  • x_scales – The scales of the input data.

  • w – The weights.

  • beta_old – The old beta values.

  • beta – The new beta values.

  • standardize – Flag indicating whether to standardize the data.

Returns:

The maximum delta value.

template<typename T>
Results slope(const T &x, const Eigen::MatrixXd &y, Eigen::ArrayXd alpha = Eigen::ArrayXd::Zero(0), Eigen::ArrayXd lambda = Eigen::ArrayXd::Zero(0), const std::string objective_choice = "gaussian", bool intercept = true, bool standardize = true, int path_length = 100, double alpha_min_ratio = 1e-4, int pgd_freq = 10, double tol = 1e-8, int max_it = 1e6, int max_it_outer = 100, bool update_clusters = false, int print_level = 0)

Calculates the slope coefficients for a linear regression model using the SortedL1Norm regularization.

Template Parameters:

T – The type of the input matrix x.

Parameters:

  • x – The input matrix of size n x p, where n is the number of observations and p is the number of predictors.

  • y – The response matrix of size n x 1.

  • alpha – The regularization parameter sequence. If not provided, it will be generated automatically.

  • lambda – The regularization parameter for the SortedL1Norm regularization. If not provided, it will be set to zero.

  • objective_choice – The choice of objective function. Default is “gaussian”.

  • intercept – Whether to fit an intercept term. Default is true.

  • standardize – Whether to standardize the predictors. Default is true.

  • path_length – The number of steps in the regularization path. Default is 100.

  • alpha_min_ratio – The minimum ratio of alpha to the maximum alpha value. Default is 1e-4.

  • pgd_freq – The frequency of running the proximal gradient descent algorithm. Default is 10.

  • tol – The tolerance for convergence. Default is 1e-8.

  • max_it – The maximum number of iterations for the inner loop. Default is 1e6.

  • max_it_outer – The maximum number of iterations for the outer loop. Default is 100.

  • update_clusters – Whether to update the clusters during coordinate descent. Default is false.

  • print_level – The level of verbosity for printing debug information. Default is 0.

Returns:

The slope coefficients, intercept values, and primal values for each step in the regularization path.
